days.theme: Iconic Las Vegas Strip & Night Views

stops.name: Eggslut at The Cosmopolitan

placeDetails.note: Trendy breakfast spot inside The Cosmopolitan known for gourmet egg sandwiches and casual vibe. Expect a line in the morning.

stops.name: Explore The Cosmopolitan & City Center Area

placeDetails.note: Walk through The Cosmopolitan, Aria, and the CityCenter complex. Check out casino floors, art installations, and Strip views from upper levels.

stops.name: Bellagio Conservatory & Fountains (Daytime Visit)

placeDetails.note: Seasonally themed indoor garden display plus a preview of the famous fountains from the Strip sidewalk. Free, photogenic, and very central.

stops.name: Mon Ami Gabi (Paris Las Vegas)

placeDetails.note: Classic French bistro with a prime patio facing the Bellagio fountains. Great for people‑watching and a relaxed mid‑day meal.

stops.name: Walk the Central Strip (Paris → Planet Hollywood → Miracle Mile Shops)

placeDetails.note: Self‑guided walk through themed resorts and an indoor mall. Good for light shopping, photos, and getting a feel for the Strip.

stops.name: LINQ Promenade & High Roller (Evening)

placeDetails.note: Outdoor pedestrian area with shops and bars plus the High Roller observation wheel for sunset or night views over the Strip.

stops.name: Yard House or Favorite Bistro (LINQ Promenade)

placeDetails.note: Casual dinner options right along the promenade; both have broad menus and are easy for a moderate budget.

stops.name: Bellagio Fountains (Night Show)

placeDetails.note: Return toward Bellagio to catch at least one full nighttime fountain show; music and lighting are more dramatic after dark.

transport.to: The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas (for Eggslut)

stops.name: Peppermill Restaurant & Fireside Lounge

placeDetails.note: Old‑school Vegas diner with huge portions and a classic neon vibe on the north Strip. Great way to start a sightseeing day.

stops.name: Welcome to Fabulous Las Vegas Sign

placeDetails.note: Iconic photo stop at the classic Vegas sign on the south Strip. Expect a short line for photos during the day.

stops.name: Mandalay Bay → Luxor → Excalibur Walkthrough

placeDetails.note: Explore the south Strip resorts with themed architecture (pyramid, castle) and indoor attractions; optional quick casino or shopping stops.

stops.name: Casual Lunch at Luxor or Excalibur Food Court/Restaurant

placeDetails.note: Choose from several moderate‑priced spots in either resort; easy for a quick break before your afternoon rest.

stops.name: Afternoon Break / Pool or Rest at Hotel

placeDetails.note: Head back to your base to relax, freshen up, or enjoy the hotel amenities before heading downtown in the evening.

stops.name: Pizza Rock (Near Downtown / Fremont)

placeDetails.note: Popular pizzeria near Fremont Street with award‑winning pies; good value and a fun atmosphere before exploring downtown.

stops.name: The Mob Museum

placeDetails.note: Interactive museum covering organized crime and law enforcement history in the U.S. and Vegas; interesting exhibits and speakeasy bar.

stops.name: Fremont Street Experience

placeDetails.note: Pedestrian mall with overhead LED canopy shows, live music stages, street performers, and classic casinos. Very lively at night.

transport.to: Welcome to Fabulous Las Vegas Sign (south Strip)

transport.mode: car or walking (if already parked nearby)

days.theme: Nevada Scenery: Red Rock Canyon & Desert Views

stops.name: Local Café Near Your Hotel (e.g., The Original Pancake House or Similar)

placeDetails.note: Fuel up before heading out of town; choose a nearby sit‑down breakfast spot or your hotel’s café.

stops.name: Drive to Red Rock Canyon Area

placeDetails.note: Head west out of Las Vegas toward the Red Rock Canyon area for desert and mountain scenery.

stops.name: Red Rock Canyon Scenic Loop & Short Walks

placeDetails.note: Scenic drive with multiple viewpoints; pick 1–2 short walks suitable for a moderate, non‑technical outing and great photos.

stops.name: Red Rock Casino or Nearby Restaurant

placeDetails.note: Stop at Red Rock Casino Resort & Spa or another nearby spot for a relaxed lunch after your scenic morning.

stops.name: Seven Magic Mountains (Colorful Desert Art Installation)

placeDetails.note: Drive south of Las Vegas to see the large, brightly painted rock stacks in the open desert. Good for photos and a short walk.

stops.name: Return to Las Vegas & Afternoon Break

placeDetails.note: Head back to your hotel to rest, pack up if needed, or enjoy one last swim or casino visit.

stops.name: Lotus of Siam or Similar Local Favorite

placeDetails.note: Well‑known Thai restaurant favored by both locals and visitors, good for a flavorful final‑night dinner in Vegas.

stops.name: Optional Last Stroll on the Strip

placeDetails.note: Take a final walk along whichever part of the Strip you enjoyed most, or pop into a favorite casino or bar before calling it a night.

transport.to: Red Rock Casino or Nearby Lunch Spot
Lotus of Siam or Dinner Spot

general: This 3‑day plan assumes you are staying in Las Vegas and have access to a car for day trips and cross‑town rides.
Times are approximate and can be shifted earlier or later by 1–2 hours based on your preference.
All outdoor activities (Red Rock Canyon and Seven Magic Mountains) are weather‑dependent; in December, expect cooler temperatures, especially in the morning and evening.
bookingSuggestions: Consider reserving popular restaurants (Eggslut, Mon Ami Gabi, Lotus of Siam) in advance, especially for prime time slots.
For the High Roller, you can buy tickets in advance online or at the LINQ box office; sunset and evening rides are most popular.
If you want to add a big Vegas show one night, you can slot it in after dinner on Day 1 or Day 2 near your chosen resort.
